meanings.definition: To create a document or image by combining photographs and text.
meanings.sent1: I will photocompose a flyer for the school event.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers often photocompose brochures for businesses.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to photocompose a picture of a cat with a hat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to photocompose memories of the past into a beautiful collage.
meanings.sent5: The software allows users to easily photocompose stunning visuals for presentations.

meanings.definition: The process of arranging photographs and text for printing.
meanings.sent1: The photocompose of the magazine layout was done meticulously.
meanings.sent2: Print shops offer services like photocompose for creating custom cards.
meanings.sent3: The photocompose of the family album brought back fond memories.
meanings.sent4: The photocompose of words and images on the poster was eye-catching.
meanings.sent5: Learning about photocompose helped her understand the art of publishing.
